name: 5-butyl-5-ethylbarbituric acid
Reason: 5-Butyl-5-ethylbarbituric acid has a melting point that is influenced by the functional groups present in the molecule. The basic unit of analysis is the barbituric acid moiety, which has a melting point of around 120°C. The addition of a 5-butyl and 5-ethyl group increases the molecular weight and steric hindrance, which can raise the melting point by approximately +20°C. The presence of these groups also introduces additional pi-pi interactions, which can contribute to the melting point.
